  "article_text": [
    "a torus @xmath0 with fundamental group marking is uniformized by the complex plane @xmath1 with variable @xmath2 and a lattice generated by @xmath3 and @xmath4 , @xmath4 in the upper half plane @xmath5 .",
    "the change of marking equivalence relation for tori is given by the action of the modular group @xmath6 on @xmath5 .",
    "the grtzsch and rauch variational formulas provide that the differential of the moduli parameter @xmath4 is represented by the quadratic differential @xmath7 . with the analogy to higher genus moduli in mind , consider @xmath5 as the teichmller space , @xmath6 as the mapping class group and the quotient as the moduli space .",
    "the compactification of the quotient @xmath8 is given by introducing the coordinate @xmath9 for a neighborhood of infinity .",
    "the differential of the nonzero moduli parameter @xmath10 is @xmath11 , which formally vanishes at infinity or equivalently @xmath12 is represented by the quadratic differential @xmath13 . in particular , quadratic differentials model the logarithmic derivative of the moduli parameter at infinity .",
    "equivalently , the moduli cotangent @xmath14 at infinity includes a @xmath10 factor .    the infinitesimal deformation space of a pair @xmath15 , a compact riemann surface and a distinguished point , is the cohomology group @xmath16 for the canonical bundle @xmath17 and the inverse of the point bundle . by kodaira - serre duality ,",
    "the dual infinitesimal deformation space is @xmath18 , the space of holomorphic quadratic differentials with possible simple poles at @xmath19 .",
    "quadratic differentials with simple poles give the moduli cotangent space .",
    "our goal is to generalize this result for nodal stable curves and describe the moduli cotangent space as a coherent analytic sheaf on the family .",
    "our discussion begins with the local geometry of the model case , the family of hyperbolas @xmath20 in @xmath21 .",
    "consider for @xmath22 positive , the singular fibration of @xmath23 over @xmath24 with the projection @xmath25 .",
    "the family @xmath26 is the local model for the formation and deformation of a node .",
    "the general fiber is an annulus and the special fiber is the union of the germ of the coordinate axes with the origin the node .",
    "the projection differential is @xmath27 .",
    "the vertical line bundle @xmath28 over @xmath29 has non vanishing section @xmath30 and the relative dualizing sheaf @xmath31 has non vanishing section @xmath32 .",
    "we consider curve families with noded stable fibers .",
    "a proper surjective map @xmath33 of analytic spaces is a family of nodal curves provided at each point @xmath34 , either @xmath35 is smooth with one dimensional fibers , or the family is locally analytically equivalent to a locus @xmath36 in @xmath37 over @xmath38 with @xmath39 vanishing at @xmath40 .",
    "the locus @xmath41 is the loci of nodes .",
    "we consider families with first order vanishing of @xmath39 ; for a neighborhood of a node the family is analytically equivalent to a cartesian product of @xmath26 and a complex manifold .",
    "stability of fibers is the condition that each component of the nodal complement in a fiber has negative euler characteristic .",
    "negative euler characteristic ensures that the automorphism group of a component is finite .",
    "the general fiber of a family @xmath33 of nodal curves is a smooth riemann surface .",
    "the locus of noded curves within the family is a divisor with normal crossings . for a family @xmath33 ,",
    "the relative dualizing sheaf is isomorphic to the product of canonical bundles @xmath42 .",
    "degenerating family @xmath43.,width=230,height=230 ]    the relative dualizing sheaf @xmath44 provides a generalization of the family of canonical bundles for a family of riemann surfaces . for @xmath45 positive",
    ", sections of @xmath46 over open sets of @xmath47 , generalize families of holomorphic @xmath45-differentials for riemann surfaces .",
    "a section @xmath48 of @xmath46 on a neighborhood of a node @xmath49 is given as @xmath50 with @xmath51 holomorphic in @xmath52 .",
    "for an annulus fiber and the mapping @xmath53 into a fiber , the section is given as @xmath54 sections of @xmath55 generalize families of holomorphic quadratic differentials and in the language of bers are families of regular @xmath56-differentials @xcite .",
    "infinitesimal opening of a node is described by the variational formula for the parameter @xmath57 . for @xmath57 nonzero",
    ", the pairing of the infinitesimal variation of @xmath57 with the section @xmath48 is given in lemma [ plumderiv ] as the @xmath58 multiple of the @xmath59-constant coefficient in the laurent expansion of @xmath60 .",
    "the appearance of the scaling @xmath57-factor is intrinsic to the variation of a node .",
    "the present appearance of the @xmath57-factor is dual to the appearance in the torus example .    the noded fibers sub family of @xmath49 is @xmath61 over @xmath62 with the restriction of the section @xmath48 to the fibers given as @xmath63 on @xmath64 and as @xmath65 on @xmath66 .",
    "the residue of @xmath48 at the node is @xmath67 .",
    "the residue is coordinate independent and well defined modulo a sign ; for @xmath45 even the residue is well defined .",
    "the kernel of the residue map to @xmath1 defines a subsheaf of @xmath55 as follows . for a family @xmath33 ,",
    "let @xmath68 be the @xmath69 component of the loci of nodes in @xmath70 and let @xmath71 be the skyscraper sheaf supported on @xmath72 .",
    "the vanishing residue subsheaf is defined by the exact sequence    @xmath73    in the preparatory lemma [ frameeval ] , we describe local bases of sections of @xmath55 over suitable opens sets of @xmath47 .",
    "the bases have a direct relationship to coordinate cotangent frames for the open sub family of riemann surfaces .",
    "lemma [ frameeval ] provides the basic tool for understanding the vanishing residue subsheaf and the moduli cotangent sheaf . in section 4",
    ", we show that the direct image @xmath74 , with presheaf of sections of @xmath75 over open sets of @xmath47 , is locally free and that the corresponding sequence of direct images is also exact .",
    "we then combine the coordinate cotangent frame for sub families property , the definition of @xmath75 and a formal argument to establish the main result .",
    "the vanishing residue exact sequence is natural for admissible families . the direct image of the vanishing residue subsheaf is naturally identified with the cotangent sheaf for admissible families .",
    "we discuss applications .",
    "a section of the moduli cotangent sheaf over an open set of the base is a section of @xmath55 over the open set with residues vanishing . in the torus example",
    "the section vanishes along the fiber and necessarily the residue vanishes . a description of the moduli cotangent fiber at a nodal curve is provided by the isomorphism between a locally free sheaf and an analytic vector bundle . for deformations of a riemann surface ,",
    "moduli cotangents are represented by quadratic differentials on the surface .",
    "for deformations of a nodal stable curve , moduli cotangents are represented by equivalence classes of sections of the vanishing residue subsheaf - it is not sufficient to specify the restriction of a section to a fiber of a family . in lemma [ cotfib ] , we find that the moduli tangent - cotangent pairing extends to noded fibers .",
    "we also consider the basic geometry of the divisor of noded curves within the family .",
    "we find that the conormal sheaf of the divisor is the subsheaf of @xmath55 with sections over base open sets vanishing along all noded fibers .",
    "the log - cotangent sheaf of the divisor is the direct image of @xmath55 , with sections of @xmath55 over base open sets .",
    "the works of masur @xcite and hubbard - koch @xcite provide a foundation for the present considerations . in section 3 , we give the construction of a standard nodal stable family of curves following masur .",
    "the construction begins with an open set in teichmller space parameterizing riemann surfaces with distinguished points and combines plumbing copies of the family @xmath26 .",
    "the constructed family provides the setting for our considerations .",
    "hubbard and koch introduce the notion of a @xmath76-marking for families of nodal stable curves , a marking modulo dehn twists about the elements of a multi curve .",
    "they construct a universal analytic family for a @xmath76-marking and show that the deligne - mumford compactification of the moduli space of riemann surfaces is analytically described by quotients of @xmath76-marked universal families . from the results of hubbard and koch , our considerations apply to the deligne - mumford compactification .    in section 5 , we generalize the laurent coefficient map of lemma 4 for expansion ( [ laurcoeff ] ) .",
    "the generalization is a period about a collar latitude of the product of a section of the vertical line bundle and a section of @xmath55 .",
    "the generalization enables direct comparison of the infinitesimal plumbings @xmath77 and @xmath20 of a node .",
    "let @xmath33 be a proper family of stable curves with a nodal fiber @xmath78 with a neighborhood of a node analytically equivalent to the cartesian product of @xmath26 and a parameter space @xmath62 .",
    "consider the local coordinates @xmath79 and @xmath80 , @xmath81 , for neighborhoods of the inverse images of the node on the normalization of @xmath78 .",
    "for the plumbing @xmath77 of @xmath78 contained in @xmath33 and @xmath48 a section of @xmath75 on a neighborhood of @xmath78 , the initial plumbing tangent evaluates as @xmath82    the formula generalizes the standard fact that for the deligne - mumford compactification the normal sheaf to the divisor of noded curves is the direct sum of products of tangent lines at distinguished points on the normalized curves .",
    "in section 6 we present three applications for the vanishing residue sheaf .",
    "the first involves the action of the automorphism group of a stable curve on infinitesimal deformations .",
    "the quotient of the action on the moduli tangent space provides a local model for the deligne - mumford compactification .",
    "we apply the main theorem and give a detailed description of the automorphism action on the vanishing residue sheaf . in the second application",
    ", we give a detailed discussion of plumbing an elliptic curve family to a @xmath83-pointed @xmath84 .",
    "we describe the initial moduli cotangent space and the action of the elliptic curves and pointed-@xmath84 involutions on moduli parameters and moduli cotangents . in the third application",
    ", we apply a standard construction for plumbing an abelian differential and compare two approaches for calculating the variation of period .",
    "i would like to especially thank john hubbard and sarah koch for valuable conversations .",

    "similar treatments are found in @xcite and @xcite .    a riemann surface with nodes @xmath182 is a connected complex space , such that every point has a neighborhood analytically isomorphic to either the unit disc in @xmath1 or the germ at the origin of the intersection of the coordinate axes in @xmath21 .",
    "the special points of @xmath182 are the nodes .",
    "we write @xmath183 for the nodal complement @xmath184 .",
    "the normalization of @xmath182 is @xmath183 with the removed nodes considered as distinguished points .",
    "functions , line bundles and sections of line bundles on @xmath182 lift to corresponding quantities on @xmath183 with a matching condition .",
    "the components of @xmath183 are the parts of @xmath182 .",
    "provided @xmath182 is compact , each component of @xmath183 is described as a compact surface minus a finite number of points .",
    "we now assume that each part has negative euler characteristic .",
    "in particular a noded riemann surface is equivalent to a stable curve @xcite .    in the kodaira - spencer setup",
    "the infinitesimal deformation space of a compact complex manifold @xmath185 is the ech cohomology @xmath186 @xcite .",
    "the infinitesimal deformation space of a pair @xmath15 , a riemann surface and a distinguished point , is @xmath16 for @xmath17 the canonical bundle and the inverse of the point line bundle @xmath19 ( @xmath187 is the line bundle with a section with divisor @xmath19 ) . by the dolbeault isomorphism @xmath188 @xmath189 the sheaf of smooth vector fields vanishing at @xmath19 @xcite .",
    "the elements of the dolbeault group are equivalence classes of @xmath190 forms with values in smooth vector fields vanishing at @xmath19 - smooth beltrami differentials .",
    "a beltrami differential @xmath191 with support disjoint from @xmath19 represents a trivial infinitesimal deformation exactly when there is a smooth vector field @xmath192 , vanishing at @xmath19 , with @xmath193 .    by kodaira - serre duality",
    "the dual of the infinitesimal deformations is @xmath18 , the space of holomorphic quadratic differentials with a possible simple pole at @xmath19 . in terms of a local coordinate @xmath2 , the integral pairing for a beltrami differential @xmath194 and a holomorphic quadratic differential @xmath195 is @xmath196 for @xmath197 the euclidean area element in @xmath2 .",
    "since holomorphic sections vanishing on an open set vanish identically , it follows that given an open set in @xmath182 there exists a basis for @xmath198 of elements supported in the open set .",
    "we describe local coordinates for the teichmller space of @xmath182 @xcite .",
    "associated to a beltrami differential of absolute value less than unity is a deformation of @xmath182 .",

    "the initial variation of a family @xmath218 can be found as follows .",
    "a one - parameter family of solutions of the beltrami equation @xmath219 has an initial variation @xmath220 $ ] satisfying the @xmath221-potential equation @xmath222_{\\bar z}=\\nu$ ] .",
    "the initial variation @xmath222 $ ] is a vector field and for deformations of the pair @xmath15 , vector fields vanish at @xmath19 .",

    "we are interested in the spaces of regular quadratic differentials for a proper family @xmath33 of stable curves .",
    "as above , the total spaces @xmath70 and @xmath47 are smooth ; @xmath35 is a submersion on the complement of a codimension @xmath56 subset ; each part of a fiber has negative euler characteristic . for a sheaf @xmath38 on @xmath70 , the direct image presheaf @xmath224 assigns to open sets @xmath225 in @xmath47 sections of @xmath38 on @xmath226 .",
    "we review that the direct image @xmath227 of the relative dualizing sheaf square is a locally free sheaf of the expected dimension - the direct image is the sheaf of holomorphic sections of a vector bundle .",
    "first we observe that the dimension of the space of regular quadratic differentials on the fibers of @xmath33 is constant .",
    "the fibers of the family are compact noded riemann surfaces ; the distinguished points on the normalization of a fiber are inverse images of nodes .",
    "a regular quadratic differential , equivalently a section of the dualizing sheaf square , is a meromorphic quadratic differential on each part with possible double poles at the inverse images of nodes and residues equal for each pair of nodal inverse images . by riemann roch and the negative euler characteristic hypothesis",
    ", for a part of genus @xmath228 with @xmath229 distinguished points the dimension of the space of quadratic differentials with possible double poles is @xmath230 .",
    "a node corresponds to a pair of distinguished points on the normalization and a pair of distinguished points contributes @xmath231 to the dimension of quadratic differentials before imposing the equal residue condition",
    ". a node net contributes @xmath83 to the dimension ; or equivalently each distinguished point on the normalization contributes a net @xmath232 to the dimension . with this counting convention ,",
    "the contribution to the dimension of regular quadratic differentials from a part of the normalization is @xmath233 , the @xmath234 multiple of the euler characteristic of the part .",
    "the euler characteristic is additive - the sum of euler characteristics of parts of a fiber coincides with the euler characteristic of the general fiber .",
    "it follows that the dimension of the space of regular quadratic differentials on a fiber is a constant , equal to the @xmath234 multiple of the euler characteristic of the general fiber . in the following , we write @xmath235 for the genus of the general fiber .",
    "the following result on families of differentials is proposition 5.1 of @xcite and proposition 4.1 of @xcite .",
    "masur proves the result by considering the sheaf of canonical forms on @xmath70 and considering the short exact sequences given by forming poincar residues onto successive hyperplane intersections with the family to define the fibers in @xmath70 .",
    "direct image sheaves are formed .",
    "grauert s theorem @xcite is applied to show that the direct image sheaves are coherent .",
    "kodaira - serre duality and a sequence chase are used to show that the poincar residue maps are surjective , his first result .",
    "he applies the result to construct local sections of @xmath236 with prescribed polar divisors .",
    "a general argument about products of @xmath3-forms is applied to find the desired families of regular quadratic differentials .",
    "we give a sketch of the much simpler hubbard - koch argument @xcite .",
    "[ locfree ] the direct image sheaf @xmath227 is locally free rank @xmath237 .",
    "a regular quadratic differential on a fiber of @xmath33 is the evaluation of a section @xmath227 .",
    "begin with a proper analytic map @xmath33 of analytic spaces and a coherent sheaf @xmath238 on @xmath70 .",
    "for a point @xmath239 , consider the fiber @xmath240 and @xmath241 the coherent sheaf on @xmath78 whose stalk at @xmath242 is the tensor product @xmath243 of the stalk of @xmath238 with the structure sheaves of @xmath70 and @xmath78 . by a form of the cartan - serre theorem with parameters the direct image of @xmath238 on @xmath47 is a locally free sheaf provided the dimensions of the cohomology groups @xmath244 are constant . for the sheaf @xmath55 the higher cohomology groups vanish and from the above discussion the zeroth cohomology has constant rank @xmath237 .",
    "the direct image sheaf is locally free of rank @xmath237 .",
    "the second statement of the lemma follows since the dimension of regular quadratic differentials equals the rank of the direct image sheaf .",
    "the general fiber of @xmath33 is a smooth riemann surface with restrictions of sections of @xmath227 to a fiber giving @xmath245 , the space of holomorphic quadratic differentials on the fiber . by hypothesis a neighborhood of each node in @xmath33 is analytically equivalent to a cartesian product with @xmath26 .",
    "the pairing of the infinitesimal variation of the parameter @xmath57 , @xmath92 , with @xmath245 is fundamental to our considerations . for the pairing ( [ serrepair ] )",
    ", the following lemma is given as formula 7.1 in @xcite , formula ( 4 ) in @xcite and in proposition 9.7 in @xcite .",
    "the proof is to give a quasiconformal map from a @xmath57-fiber of @xmath26 to a @xmath246-fiber , compute the initial @xmath246-derivative of the beltrami differential and compute the pairing ( [ serrepair ] ) with a quadratic differential on the @xmath57-fiber .",
    "the quasiconformal map can be given to preserve concentric circles and as a rotation near the boundary .",

    "we now construct a general family for varying a nodal stable curve / a riemann surface with nodes @xmath249 . in the next section ,",
    "we describe the hubbard - koch theorem for the universal property of the family .",
    "varying @xmath249 is given as a combination of quasiconformal deformations of a relatively compact set in the normalization of @xmath249 and gluings to copies of the family @xmath26 .",
    "the construction only uses that beltrami differentials define finite deformations .",
    "ech style sliding deformations could equally be used in the construction in place of beltrami differentials .",
    "we start with the normalization of @xmath249 : a riemann surface @xmath182 with formally paired distinguished points @xmath250 with corresponding local coordinates @xmath251 near @xmath252 , @xmath253 , @xmath254 near @xmath255 , @xmath256 and with beltrami differentials @xmath257 a basis for the cohomology group @xmath258 .",
    "we require that the domains of the local coordinates @xmath259 are mutually disjoint and that the union of local coordinate domains is disjoint from the union of beltrami differential supports .",
    "let @xmath260 with @xmath215 small and let @xmath213 be the deformation described above by quasiconformal maps .",

    "the coordinates @xmath259 are holomorphic for @xmath218 , given the disjoint support hypothesis .",

    ", remove from @xmath218 the discs @xmath266 and @xmath267 to obtain an open surface @xmath268 .",

    "boundary neighborhoods of individual fibers of @xmath270 are glued to boundary neighborhoods of individual fibers of @xmath26 .",

    "the result is a family of compact possibly noded riemann surfaces @xmath277 with projection - in brief the family given by a boundary neighborhood gluing of @xmath270 and @xmath262 copies of the plumbing .",
    "the plumbings determine labeled annuli in the fibers of the family .",
    "the constructed family @xmath277 is an @xmath181 family .",
    "the total space and base of an @xmath181 family are complex manifolds and the projection is proper and a submersion except on the combined nodal set of codimension @xmath56 . by construction ,",
    "a neighborhood of a node in an @xmath181 family is analytically equivalent to a cartesian product of @xmath26 and a complex manifold .",
    "the dimension count for regular quadratic differentials provides for @xmath235 the genus of a smooth fiber that the dimensions satisfy @xmath278 .",

    "the matrix of evaluating pairings and laurent coefficients is holomorphic and the identity at the origin .",
    "the matrix inverse applied to the sections @xmath301 gives the desired sections with the desired pairings and laurent coefficients .",

    "we consider proper families of stable curves @xmath33 including nodal curves with @xmath70 and @xmath47 smooth manifolds .",
    "we assume a neighborhood of each node is analytically equivalent to a cartesian product of @xmath26 and a complex manifold parameter space .",
    "the cartesian product structure provides that the locus of nodes is a disjoint union of codimension @xmath56 smooth subvarieties .",
    "a section of @xmath55 has a canonical residue at a node ; the residue is computed on the normalization .",
    "we consider the vanishing residue subsheaf @xmath75 of @xmath55 and the associated exact sequence .",
    "the direct image sheaf @xmath74 is shown to be locally free and the sequence of direct images is exact .",
    "the hubbard and koch characterization and description of a universal family are applied to show that the direct image @xmath74 is the cotangent sheaf for an admissible family .",

    "we use the work of hubbard and koch to relate @xmath181 families @xcite .",
    "hubbard and koch study proper flat families of nodal curves ( * ? ? ?",
    "* definition 3.1 ) .",
    "a proper surjective analytic map @xmath33 of analytic spaces is a family of nodal curves provided at each point @xmath34 , either @xmath35 is smooth with one dimensional fibers or the family is locally isomorphic to the locus of @xmath36 in @xmath325 over @xmath62 with @xmath39 vanishing at the image of @xmath40 .",
    "we work with the case of first order vanishing of @xmath39 , where families are locally analytically equivalent to the cartesian product of @xmath26 and a complex manifold ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 10 , proposition 2.1 ) .",
    "families are further assumed to be @xmath76-marked ,",
    "@xmath76 a multi curve on a reference surface ( * ? ? ?",
    "* definitions 5.1 , 5.2 and 5.5 ) ; a @xmath76-marking is a continuous section into a family of cosets of mapping classes from a reference surface to the fibers of the family .",
    "they show in their proposition 5.7 that a proper flat family @xmath33 of stable curves has a @xmath76-marking if and only if there is a hausdorff closed set @xmath326 such that : i ) each component of @xmath327 is either an annulus or a one point union of discs ( a degenerate annulus ) and ii ) @xmath328 is a trivial bundle of surfaces with boundary .",
    "the multi curve @xmath76 represents the annuli that can degenerate in the family .    by construction @xmath181",
    "families are proper flat with fibers stable curves with hausdorff closet set the complement of the plumbing annuli .",
    "an @xmath181 family is an example of their @xmath76-marked plumbed analytic family @xmath329 ( * ? ? ?",
    "* sections 8.2 , 8.3 ) .",
    "they also construct a standard model family @xmath330 ( * ? ? ?",
    "* definition 7.1 , section 7.1 ) . by their theorem 9.11 ,",
    "the induced map from a neighborhood of the origin in the base of an @xmath181 family into @xmath331 is a @xmath76-marking preserving topological equivalence of families .",
    "their theorem 10.1 provides that for an @xmath181 family @xmath277 , @xmath76-marked by plumbing annuli , there is a unique analytic map of @xmath279 into @xmath331 such that the @xmath76-marked family @xmath330 pulls back to a @xmath76-marked family analytically equivalent to @xmath277 .",
    "in particular , @xmath181 families provide local analytic descriptions for the standard model family @xmath330 .",
    "furthermore , for a pair of @xmath181 families with a common fiber , there are neighborhoods of the base points and @xmath76-markings such that the families over the neighborhoods are uniquely @xmath76-marked equivalent under a biholomorphism .",
    "basic considerations provide that standard model families @xmath330 and @xmath181 families are locally _ kuranishi _ ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 11 , section 4 ) .",
    "a deformation of a curve @xmath249 is a family of noded curves @xmath33 and basepoint @xmath332 with a prescribed analytic equivalence of @xmath249 to the fiber @xmath333 .",
    "a deformation @xmath33 of a curve @xmath249 is kuranishi provided for any deformation of the curve @xmath334 and basepoint @xmath335 , that the family @xmath334 is locally at @xmath336 the pullback of the family @xmath33 locally at @xmath337 by a unique morphism respecting the equivalences to @xmath249 .",
    "existence of a kuranishi family for a curve is equivalent to stability of the curve ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 11 , theorem 4.3 ) .",
    "in particular , a standard model family @xmath330 with basepoint @xmath338 is locally the pullback of a kuranishi family . at the same time",
    ", the kuranishi family is locally @xmath76-marked by plumbing annuli .",
    "the hubbard and koch theorem 10.1 provides that the kuranishi family is locally the pullback of the standard model family .",
    "in particular , the families are locally equivalent for neighborhoods of the designated fibers . the local uniqueness property for the kuranishi family transfers to the standard model family .",
    "kuranishi families have many general properties ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 11 , section 4 ) .",
    "an admissible family is a proper @xmath76-marked family @xmath33 of stable curves with a neighborhood of each node analytically equivalent to a cartesian product of @xmath26 and a complex manifold .",
    "hubbard and koch use their standard model family to define an analytic structure for the quotient of the augmented teichmller space by local actions of mapping class groups ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 12 ) . in theorem 13.1 , they show that the constructed space is analytically equivalent to the analytic form of the deligne - mumford compactification of the moduli space of riemann surfaces . in particular @xmath181 families",
    "provide local analytic descriptions for the local manifold covers of the deligne - mumford compactification .",
    "[ main ] the vanishing residue sequence ( [ vanseq ] ) is natural for admissible families . the direct image of the vanishing residue sheaf is naturally identified with the cotangent bundle for admissible families .",
    "the proof is formal given the present considerations ; we use simplified notation .",
    "we use local descriptions in terms of @xmath181 families . for @xmath76-marked families",
    "@xmath277 and @xmath339 with a common fiber , there is a biholomorphic equivalence of the families over neighborhoods of the common base point ; restrict the families to the neighborhoods .",
    "if the number of nodes on the common fiber is not maximal for the families then @xmath262 and @xmath340 can be distinct .",
    "the relative dualizing sheaf is characterized either by its dualizing property or as the dual of the vertical line bundle .",
    "the nodal loci are characterized by self crossing of the fiber of the projection and the residue on the normalization is intrinsic .",
    "a biholomorphism @xmath192 pulls back the second family to the first family .",
    "the vanishing residue exact sequence for the second family pulls back to the vanishing residue exact sequence for the first family . on the domain of @xmath192",
    "the coordinate cotangents are related by @xmath341 for an analytic jacobian . by lemma [ frameeval ] , on the open",
    "set @xmath342 the cotangents are represented by the second @xmath181 frames @xmath343 for @xmath344 and @xmath345 for @xmath346 . on the open set the second frames satisfy the relation @xmath347 the left and right hand sides independently give @xmath237 analytic sections of @xmath348 and @xmath74 .",
    "the relation is consequently satisfied on the domain of @xmath192 .",
    "since @xmath345 and @xmath343 are local bases for the locally free sheaves @xmath349 and @xmath74 and @xmath350 is the cocycle for the cotangent bundle , it follows that the direct image of @xmath75 is analytically equivalent to the cotangent bundle .",
    "the equivalence does not depend on the particular representation as an @xmath181 family .",
    "for an admissible family the equivalence is given by any local representation .",
    "for an admissible family the form for a local frame of @xmath74 is determined by general considerations .",
    "begin with the restriction map from the relative dualizing sheaf to the dualizing sheaf of a fiber . by the dimension",
    "count leading to lemma [ locfree ] , for a noded fiber the space of sections of the dualizing sheaf square vanishing at nodes has codimension the number of nodes . by the same count",
    ", for each node there is a local section of the dualizing sheaf square with unit residue at the node and vanishing at other nodes . now",
    "the product of a function defining the associated locus of nodal curves in the base and a section of the relative dualizing sheaf square with constant unit residue is a section of @xmath74 corresponding to the node . as sections of @xmath74 , the constructed products are locally independent and independent from sections with non trivial restrictions to the fiber .",
    "the collection of sections provides a local frame for @xmath74 .",
    "we will see below that a section of @xmath74 vanishing on noded fibers is a conormal to the locus of noded curves .",
    "[ cotanframe ] for an @xmath181 family the second @xmath181 frame is the coordinate cotangent frame .    to understand the description of the cotangent fibers , we review the isomorphism between locally free sheaves and analytic vector bundles . associated to an analytic vector bundle @xmath351 over a connected complex manifold @xmath185 is the sheaf @xmath352 of analytic sections .",

    "the conclusion follows .",
    "we can describe the cotangent fiber at a point for the curve @xmath249 by giving sections of the dualizing sheaf square and local coordinates at the nodes .",

    "we will see in theorem [ compplum ] that the cotangent vectors depend on the second order expansions of the local coordinates .",
    "the local cartesian product description at a node provides that for an admissible family @xmath33 , the locus @xmath400 of noded curves is a divisor with normal crossings . in general for a normal crossing divisor in a complex manifold @xmath185 , there are local analytic coordinates @xmath401 with @xmath402 for @xmath403 .",
    "we are interested in three cotangent constructions associated to the divisor @xmath404 of noded curves .",
    "the first is the dual of the normal sheaf of @xmath404 , the conormal @xmath405 , defined by the exact sequence @xmath406 for @xmath407 the sheaf of @xmath3-forms on @xmath185 and @xmath408 the sheaf of khler differentials for @xmath404 @xcite .",
    "the conormal is the set of cotangent vectors to @xmath185 supported on @xmath404 and is the annihilator of the tangents to the intersection of @xmath404 components .",
    "for example , at a point of @xmath409 , the conormal is the annihilator of the intersection @xmath410 of tangent spaces . at the same point ,",
    "the conormal sections are generated by the differentials @xmath411 and the khler differentials are generated by @xmath412 .",
    "the second cotangent construction is the log - cotangent bundle @xmath413 for a normal crossing divisor .",
    "the log - cotangent is a subsheaf of the sheaf of meromorphic @xmath3-differentials with @xmath414 the sheaf of analytic @xmath3-differentials . at the above point of @xmath404 ,",
    "the sheaf is locally generated by the differentials @xmath415 .",
    "the log - cotangent bundle is locally free of rank @xmath416 .",
    "the third cotangent construction , supported on @xmath404 , is the space of cotangents represented on the normalizations of the stable curves by holomorphic quadratic differentials ; the differentials are holomorphic at the nodal inverse images . in theorem",
    "[ compplum ] , we show that the space of such cotangents is the annihilator of the infinitesimal plumbing tangents .    for an @xmath181 family @xmath277 with parameters",
    "@xmath417 the divisor @xmath404 of noded curves is @xmath418 with @xmath419 .",
    "the locus @xmath404 is the codimension @xmath262 locus with parameters @xmath420 .",
    "[ logpolframe ] for an @xmath181 family the log - cotangent bundle is generated by the first @xmath181 frame .",
    "the conormal of @xmath404 is generated by the elements @xmath421 of the second @xmath181 frame .",
    "the statements are direct consequences of corollary [ cotanframe ] and lemma [ frameeval ] .",

    "the vertical line bundle @xmath28 is dual to the relative dualizing sheaf @xmath31 . for a section @xmath423 of @xmath28 , nonzero at the node ,",
    "the adjoint residue value , defined modulo a sign , is the residue of the dual section @xmath424 at the node .",
    "the @xmath425 fibers of the family @xmath26 are annuli . for @xmath48 a section of @xmath31 and @xmath426 a loop in a fiber winding once around the annulus , then the integral @xmath427 is the @xmath428 multiple of the zeroth laurent coefficient of the restriction of @xmath48 to the fiber with the sign of the integral uniquely determined by the orientation of @xmath426 .    .",
    ", width=240,height=240 ]    given @xmath423 a section of @xmath28 with adjoint residue value @xmath165 , a collection of loops @xmath429 in the fibers @xmath430 , is admissible provided @xmath431 . for @xmath247 a section of @xmath422 and @xmath423 with admissible loops @xmath429 , the laurent pairing is @xmath432    we consider properties of the pairing .",
    "the product @xmath433 is a section of @xmath31 and the integrals only depend on the homology classes of the loops .",
    "the integrals do not depend on a choice of coordinates .",
    "the pairing is analytic in @xmath57 and for @xmath247 a section of the vanishing residue sheaf @xmath75 , then @xmath434 vanishes at @xmath91 . in particular for @xmath247 a section of @xmath75 the limit @xmath435 exists .    to find additional properties of the limit",
    ", we introduce expansions for @xmath423 and @xmath247 and calculate . for the local cartesian product description @xmath171",
    ", the considerations will only involve continuity in @xmath62 and so we omit @xmath62 dependence in the expansions .",
    "we begin with a section of @xmath31 and its dual section of @xmath28 . from section [ locgeom ] , for an annulus @xmath168 with variable @xmath59 mapped into a fiber of @xmath29 by @xmath436 , then a @xmath3-differential @xmath437 pulls back to @xmath438 on @xmath168 . for a loop @xmath426 in @xmath168 with @xmath439 ,",

    "an easy application is the standard formula for the normal sheaf to the divisor @xmath404 of noded curves ( * ? ? ?",
    "* props . 3.31 , 3.32 ) .",
    "the normal sheaf is the quotient of the tangent sheaf by the intersection of the tangent sheaves of components of @xmath404 .",
    "for an @xmath181 family @xmath277 with parameters @xmath470 , the intersection of components of @xmath404 has parameters @xmath471 .",
    "the normal sheaf is the quotient of the @xmath57 parameter tangents modulo the @xmath261 parameter tangents .",
    "the infinitesimal sliding deformations are represented by compactly supported beltrami differentials on the normalization of a curve .",
    "in particular , the infinitesimal slidings are tangents to the intersection of components of @xmath404 .",
    "theorem [ compplum ] provides the relation @xmath472 between the plumbings @xmath77 and @xmath20 of a node .",
    "the factor @xmath473 is the cocycle for the tensor product of tangent lines to the normalized curve at the inverse images of the node . in particular , the normal line is the product of tangent lines .",

    "the mapping class group @xmath482 acts on @xmath76-markings by a right action of precomposition of maps . in analogy to the local topological triviality of families of compact surfaces , hubbard - koch show that the projection @xmath501 has discrete fibers and a local section through each point ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 5.4 ) .",
    "a direct characterization of @xmath76-markable families is provided ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 5.7 ) .",
    "let @xmath502 with @xmath76-marking @xmath503 be the hubbard - koch universal @xmath76-marked family .",
    "the natural map from a connected open set in the base of an @xmath181 family into the base @xmath504 provides a @xmath76-marking preserving analytic equivalence of the @xmath181 family to the pullback family .",
    "the universal property provides that a mapping class @xmath505 which acts by a right action by precomposition on @xmath76-markings , acts by a left action on the base @xmath504 by an analytic equivalence @xmath506 and on the total space by an analytic equivalence @xmath507 to give the family @xmath508 with marking @xmath509 ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 10.1 ) .",
    "if each neighborhood of a basepoint @xmath510 of the family intersects its @xmath506 translate , then @xmath506 fixes @xmath510 and the mapping class @xmath511 is realized by an automorphism acting on the @xmath510 fiber ( * ? ?",
    "* proposition 2.6 ) .",

    "we showed in theorem [ main ] that an analytic equivalence of families acts by pulling back the vanishing residue sheaf .",
    "in particular maps @xmath507 act by pulling back @xmath521 the direct image of the vanishing residue sheaf .",
    "in particular for @xmath522 and associated map @xmath507 , we have by definition of the extending sheaf sections map that @xmath523 for @xmath393 . in general the coordinates @xmath524 and @xmath525 are distinct and extensions of sections are not preserved by pulling back .    the group @xmath513 acting on the normalization @xmath182 has cyclic stabilizer at each distinguished point .",
    "local coordinates can be chosen with each stabilizer acting by rotations . for such coordinates , @xmath513 acts by permutations and rotations of coordinates .",

    "we describe plumbing elliptic curves ( flat tori ) to a projective line @xmath84 pointed at @xmath112 , @xmath527 and @xmath3 .",
    "the general plumbing gives a genus @xmath56 surface with hyperelliptic involution .",
    "we consider the family cotangent frame and the action of the automorphism group of the initial fiber .",
    "the construction begins with an elliptic curve @xmath528 with variable @xmath2 , universal cover @xmath1 and lattice deck transformation group generated by @xmath3 and @xmath529 .",
    "an elliptic curve has quadratic differentials @xmath530 and @xmath531 for the weierstrass @xmath532-function .",
    "the @xmath532-function is doubly periodic with singular part @xmath533 at the origin ; @xmath534 has unit residue at the origin .",
    "an elliptic curve has the involution @xmath535 with the differentials @xmath530 and @xmath534 involution invariant . the projective line @xmath84 with variable @xmath100 has abelian differentials @xmath536 with residues @xmath3 at @xmath537 and @xmath527 at @xmath510 .",
    "the projective line @xmath84 pointed at @xmath112 , @xmath527 and @xmath3 has the involution @xmath538 .",
    "define a nodal stable curve @xmath249 by pairing distinguished points as follows .",

    "half dehn twist for a @xmath3-handle _ , or equivalently the _ @xmath56-torsion associated with an elliptic tail .",
    "_      we apply a standard construction for plumbing an abelian differential and then calculate the variation of its period .",
    "the plumbing provides an example of a section of the direct image of @xmath75 as a cotangent sheaf section and a demonstration for rauch s period variation formula @xcite .",
    "we calculate the period variation by two approaches and then compare .",
    "begin with a compact riemann surface @xmath182 with a canonical homology basis @xmath609 , given by representative cycles and with points @xmath610 disjoint from the cycles . by riemann - roch",
    "there is a meromorphic abelian differential with residue @xmath527 at @xmath510 and @xmath3 at @xmath537 @xcite .",
    "the meromorphic differential is unique modulo the analytic differentials .",
    "a unique differential @xmath611 of the third kind is determined by the condition of vanishing periods on the given homology basis .",
    "introduce local coordinates @xmath563 at @xmath537 and @xmath110 at @xmath510 , such that @xmath612 , and such that the charts include the discs @xmath613 .",
    "coordinates @xmath614 are analytically specified by the condition that on the discs , @xmath611 is respectively given as @xmath615 and as @xmath616 .",
    "we can use the coordinates to describe points near @xmath537 or @xmath510 . introduce an arc @xmath617 from @xmath618 to @xmath619 , disjoint from the basis of cycles and contained in @xmath620 .",
    "the plumbing of @xmath182 is as follows .",
    "given @xmath57 nonzero , remove the closed discs @xmath621 and @xmath622 . overlap the annuli @xmath623 and @xmath624 by @xmath580 to obtain the plumbed surface @xmath625 . since the identification is @xmath626 , the differential @xmath611 plumbs to a differential @xmath627 on @xmath625 .",
    "introduce an oriented arc @xmath429 from @xmath3 to @xmath57 in the annulus @xmath628 and disjoint from @xmath629 .",
    "the arc concatenation @xmath630 determines an oriented cycle on @xmath625 , disjoint from the original basis of cycles .",
    "the image of the positively oriented circle @xmath631 also defines a cycle @xmath632 . by construction",
    "the integral of @xmath627 over @xmath632 is unity and the genus of @xmath625 is one greater than the genus of @xmath182 .",
    "the combination of images of cycles @xmath633 is a canonical homology basis for @xmath625 .",
    "the abelian differential @xmath627 is the dual to @xmath632 relative to the @xmath168 cycles of the basis .",
    "the period @xmath634 is an entry in the riemann period matrix of @xmath625 .",
    "we set @xmath635 and from the above construction @xmath636 .",
    "the exponential of the period @xmath637 extends to an analytic function on the disc @xmath638 .",
    "the derivative of the function is @xmath639 .",
    "we can also calculate the derivative by combining rauch s variational formula ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 2 ) and lemma [ plumderiv ] .",
    "preliminary observations are necessary .",
    "first , by construction in a neighborhood of the plumbing , the @xmath57 family @xmath625 coincides with the family @xmath26 .",
    "second , @xmath625 locally embeds into a fiber of @xmath26 by the map @xmath640 and consequently @xmath641 is the pullback of @xmath642 on @xmath29 .",
    "third , rauch s formula is given in terms of the @xmath56-form @xmath643 for the beltrami - quadratic differential pairing , whereas the present formulas are given in terms of the @xmath56-form @xmath197 ; see ( [ serrepair ] ) . applying the period variation formula , lemma [ plumderiv ] and the observations gives @xmath644 in a neighborhood of the plumbing , @xmath627 is given as @xmath645 and @xmath646 combining contributions , the derivative of the exponential of the period is @xmath647 , matching the direct calculation .    the derivative formula can be expressed as the differential of a function by @xmath648 .",
    "the family @xmath625 is one dimensional with coordinate @xmath649 with @xmath650 a constant .",
    "the derivative formula can also be given as @xmath651 , with the right hand side a second frame element , in particular a section of the direct image sheaf @xmath74 .",
    "enrico arbarello , maurizio cornalba , and phillip  a. griffiths . ,",
    "volume 268 of _ grundlehren der mathematischen wissenschaften [ fundamental principles of mathematical sciences]_. springer , heidelberg , 2011 . with a contribution by joseph daniel harris .",
    "e.  arbarello , m.  cornalba , p.  a. griffiths , and j.  harris . ,",
    "volume 267 of _ grundlehren der mathematischen wissenschaften [ fundamental principles of mathematical sciences]_. springer - verlag , new york , 1985 .",
    "lipman bers .",
    "spaces of degenerating riemann surfaces . in _ discontinuous groups and riemann surfaces ( proc .",
    "maryland , college park , md . , 1973 )",
    "_ , pages 4355 .",
    "ann . of math .",
    "studies , no .",
    "princeton univ . press ,",
    "princeton , n.j .",
    ", 1974 .",
    "scott  a. wolpert .",
    "eometry of the weil - petersson completion of teichmller space . in _",
    "surveys in differential geometry viii : papers in honor of calabi , lawson , siu and uhlenbeck _ , pages 357393 .",
    "press , cambridge , ma , 2003 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> an analytic approach and description are presented for the moduli cotangent sheaf for suitable stable curve families including noded fibers . for sections of the square of the relative dualizing sheaf , </S>",
    "<S> the residue map at a node gives rise to an exact sequence . </S>",
    "<S> the residue kernel defines the vanishing residue subsheaf . for suitable stable curve families , </S>",
    "<S> the direct image sheaf on the base is locally free and the sequence of direct images is exact . </S>",
    "<S> recent work of hubbard - koch and a formal argument provide that the direct image sheaf is naturally identified with the moduli cotangent sheaf . </S>",
    "<S> the result generalizes the role of holomorphic quadratic differentials as cotangents for smooth curve families . </S>",
    "<S> formulas are developed for the pairing of an infinitesimal opening of a node and a section of the direct image sheaf . </S>",
    "<S> applications include an analytic description of the conormal sheaf for the locus of noded stable curves and a formula comparing infinitesimal openings of a node . </S>",
    "<S> the moduli action of the automorphism group of a stable curve is described . </S>",
    "<S> an example of plumbing an abelian differential and the corresponding period variation is presented . </S>"
  ]
}
